idea:
Initiated in August 2016 and formalized as Private Limited Company on 1st April, 2017,
RECITY (https://www.recity.in/) provides consulting services to ULBs to create and implement
end to end systemic solutions for urban problems. This is done by creating 'platforms'
where the government, citizens and experts interact and problem- solve together,
whereby creating the synergy necessary to bring about change.

Recity focuses on the following agendas within Urban development:

• Waste Management: Solid waste management is one of the most basic essential services
provided by municipal authorities. However, it is among the most poorly rendered services
– the systems applied are unscientific, outdated and inefficient. It is estimated that India will
have to invest close to US$11 billion in solid waste management alone over the next 20
years. RECITY’s engagement with citizen groups and government bodies like APMC, Navi
Mumbai Municipal Corporation and Ambala Municipal Corporation has helped it create city
level integrated solutions for Waste Collection, segregation, disposal and monitoring.

• Water Resilience: Water resources and related infrastructure usually emphasizes the
need to be resilient, secure and sustainable. In the Indian context, where we have large
ground to cover, this means that we need a system that encompasses practical policymaking,
implementable infrastructure solutions, citizen participation, and monitoring and
evaluation systems to save and harvest water and also route this water back to the citizens
during disruptive events. This requires social as well as technical engineering, and a
movement like RECITY to enable the complex interactions between the citizenry,
government, and the technological experts.

• Sanitation: Recity brings together government, private sector, NGOs, multi & bilateral,
foundations, trusts, civil society and citizens at large to create synergies to work towards
the entire sanitation value chain. We implement behavior change communication, design
end to end infrastructure solutions, citizen participation, develop citizen feedback solutions
and help ULBs to set up monitoring and evaluation systems

idea:

If this idea is implemented by everyone in India, a huge amount of Copper wiring can be saved. India and the world can go Greener. 


That excites us at Ebullient Automation LLP and we are looking to develop the Prototype at the earliest to capture the booming Smart Home Industry.
